sen.j: 亀岡駅（かめおかえき）は、京都府亀岡市追分町谷筋にある、西日本旅客鉄道（JR西日本）山陰本線（嵯峨野線）の駅である。
sen.e: Kameoka Station, located in Tanisuji, Oiwake-cho, Kameoka City, Kyoto Prefecture, is the station of San'in main Line (Sagano Line) that is operated by West Japan Railway Company (JR West).
Kameoka Station, located in Tanisuji, Oiwake-cho, Kameoka City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a facility of the San'in main Line (Sagano Line), which is operated by the West Japan Railway Company (JR West).
Kameoka Station, located in Tanisuji, Oiwake-cho, Kameoka City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a facility of the Sanin Main Line (Sagano Line), which is operated by the West Japan Railway Company (JR West).

sen.j: 丹波口駅から園部駅までを管理する管理駅でもある。
sen.e: This station is responsible for the administration of the section between Tambaguchi Station and Sonobe Station.
This station is responsible for the administration of the section between Tambaguchi Station and Sonobe Station.
This station is responsible for the administration of the section between Tanbaguchi Station and Sonobe Station.

sen.j: 駅名電略は「フチカオ」。
sen.e: The abbreviated station name for telegraph is "fuchioka".
The abbreviated station name (for telegraph) is "fuchioka."
The abbreviated station name (for telegraph) is 'Fuchioka.'

sen.j: ICOCA・Jスルー利用可能駅（相互利用可能ICカードはICOCAの項を参照）。
sen.e: ICOCA and J-through are available at this station (regarding IC cards which are mutually usable, refer to the column of ICOCA).
ICOCA and J-through are available at this station (refer to the column on ICOCA for information regarding IC cards that are mutually usable).
ICOCA and J-through cards can be used at this station (refer to the column on ICOCA for information regarding IC cards that are mutually usable).
sen.cmt: can be used としました。

sen.j: 普通電車の一部が折り返す駅で、全ての特急列車も停車する。
sen.e: At this station, Local trains make a turn and all Limited Express trains stop.
At this station, each local train makes a turn and all limited express trains stop.
At this station, each local train makes a turn and all limited express trains stop.

sen.j: 当駅から園部方面は快速も各駅に停車する。
sen.e: Rapid trains running toward Sonobe side also stop at all stations after stopping at this station.
Rapid trains running toward the Sonobe side also stop at all stations after stopping at this station.
Rapid trains running toward the Sonobe side also stop at all stations after stopping at this station.

sen.j: 駅構造
sen.e: Structure of the station
The station's structure
Station layout

sen.j: 島式2面4線のプラットホームを持つ、待避・交換可能な橋上駅舎を持つ地上駅。
sen.e: This station is a ground station that has 2 island-style platforms for 4 tracks and a station building on the bridge, which is usable as a shelter and replaceable.
sen.cmt: 待避・交換可能な橋上駅舎→原文の意味が理解できません。仮訳しておりますが、ご検討ください。
sen.e: This station is a ground station that has two island-style platforms for four tracks and a station building on the bridge, which is replaceable and usable as a shelter.

This station is a ground station that has two island-style platforms for four tracks and a station building on the bridge, where trains can wait for other trains to pass as well as an inbound and outbound trains can pass each other.
sen.cmt: 「退避」は他の電車待ちが行えること、「交換」は上下列車が行き違うことではないかと解釈し、左記のようにいたしました。

sen.j: 戦中（1943年）に建てられた駅舎が（2006年2月まで現存）あったが、橋上駅化工事のため取り壊された。
sen.e: The old station building (it had existed until February, 2006) that was constructed during wartime (1943) was demolished due to the construction work of a new station building on the bridge.
The old station building (existent until February 2006), which was constructed during wartime (1943), was demolished due to the construction work of a new station building on the bridge.
The old station building (existent until February 2006), which was constructed during wartime (1943), was demolished due to the construction work of a new station building on the bridge.

sen.j: 駅舎改築中は京都側に仮駅舎・仮跨線橋を設置して対応していたが、2008年4月12日より新しい橋上駅舎及び南北自由通路の供用を開始した。
sen.e: During the period of renovation work of the station building, the temporary station building and overpass were set on Kyoto side of the station but on April 12, 2008, new station building on the bridge and the free passage that runs north and south were placed in service.

During the period of renovation work of the station building, the temporary station building and overpass were set on the Kyoto side of the station, but on April 12, 2008, a new station building on the bridge and the free passage that runs north and south were placed in service.

During the period of renovation work of the station building, the temporary station building and overpass were set on the Kyoto side of the station, but on April 12, 2008, a new station building on the bridge and the free passage that runs north and south were placed in service.

sen.j: また、橋上駅舎の完成に伴い、駅北側にも駅前広場が整備された。
sen.e: Along with the completion of the station building on the bridge, the station square was also completed on the north side of the station.
Along with the completion of the station building on the bridge, the station square was also completed on the north side of the station.
Along with the completion of the station building on the bridge, the station square was also completed on the north side of the station.

sen.j: 亀岡市ふるさとバスのうち、路線番号1・2・3及び保津川下りの送迎バスは北口から発着する。
sen.e: Route 1, 2 and 3 of Kameoka Furusato Bus as well as shuttle bus for Hozu-gawa River Boat Ride depart from and arrive at the north entrance of the station.
Routes 1, 2 and 3 of Kameoka Furusato Bus, as well as shuttle bus for the Hozu-gawa River Boat Ride, depart from and arrive at the north entrance of the station.
Route 1, 2 and 3 of Kameoka Furusato Bus, as well as shuttle bus for the Hozu-gawa River Boat Ride, depart from and arrive at the north exit of the station.

sen.j: 南北自由通路には公募により「のどかめロード（「のどか」と「亀岡」の合成造語）」の愛称が付けられている。
sen.e: The free passage that runs north and south was named "Nodo-Kame Road" (a synthesized term of "nodoka (calm)" and "Kameoka") which was chosen from entries from the public.
The free passage that runs north and south was called "Nodo-Kame Road" (a synthesized term of "nodoka (calm)" and "Kameoka"), which was chosen from entries submitted by the public.
The free passage that runs north and south was called 'Nodo-Kame Road' (a synthesized term of 'nodoka' (calm) and 'Kameoka'), which was chosen from entries submitted by the public.

sen.j: 通常は駅本屋側から順番に乗り場の番号が割り振られるが、当駅は旧駅本屋側（南側）から逆順である（他の嵯峨野線の駅でもこのような形が多い）。
sen.e: The track number is usually allocated in order starting from the side of main station building, but in the case of this station, it is allocated in reverse from the side of old station building (south side) (many of other stations of the Sagano Line adopt this formula).

The platform number is usually allocated in order starting from the side of the main station building, but in the case of this station it is allocated in reverse from the side of the old station building (south side) (and many other stations on the Sagano Line employ this formula).

The platform number is usually allocated in order starting from the side of the main station building, but in the case of this station it is allocated in reverse from the side of the old station building (south side) (and many other stations on the Sagano Line employ this formula).

sen.j: なお、新駅舎完成後も当面2番のりばは使用停止のままとなっている。
sen.e: Even after completion of the new station building, track 2 is not in service for the time being.
Even after completion of the new station building, track 2 isn't in service for the time being.
Even after completion of the new station building, Platform 2 isn't in service for the time being.

sen.j: 今後2番線のレールを少し3番線側へ移動する工事とホームの拡張工事が行われる。
sen.e: In near future, work of shifting track 2 toward track 3 side a little and expanding the platform is expected to be carried out.
In near future, the work of shifting track 2 slightly toward the track 3 side and expanding the platform is expected to be carried out.
In the near future, the work of shifting Platform 2 slightly toward the Platform 3 side and expanding the platform is expected to be carried out.
sen.cmt: in the としました。「No.番線」の表記を統一

sen.j: そのため2番ホームは仮囲いにより狭くなっている。
sen.e: Under such circumstances, the platform of track 2 is narrow at the moment due to temporary fence.
Under such circumstances, the platform of track 2 is narrow at the moment due to a temporary fence.
Under such circumstances, the platform of Platform 2 is narrow at the moment due to a temporary fence.

sen.j: 利用状況
sen.e: Status of usage
Conditions of usage
Passenger use
sen.cmt: 表現を他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 2006年度の1日あたりの乗車人員は約9,877人である。（京都府統計書より）
sen.e: Average number of passengers a day in 2006 was 9877 (based on the statistics compiled by Kyoto Prefectural Government).
According to statistics compiled by the Kyoto Prefectural Government, the average number of passengers daily in 2006 was 9,877.
According to statistics compiled by the Kyoto Prefectural Government, the average number of passengers daily in fiscal year 2006 was 9,877.

sen.j: 亀岡市の代表駅であり、京都・大阪のベッドタウンとして発展している場所柄、利用客は非常に多く、時間帯によっては、この駅から京都方面への列車が相当な混雑になる。
sen.e: As this station is the central station of Kameoka City that has been developing as bedroom suburbs of Kyoto and Osaka, the number of passengers is very big and depending on the time zone, the congestion on the trains bound for Kyoto is relatively heavy.

Because this is the central station of Kameoka City, which has developed as a bedroom suburb of Kyoto and Osaka, the number of passengers is very large and, depending on the time zone, the congestion on trains bound for Kyoto is relatively heavy.

Because this is the central station of Kameoka City, which has developed as a bedroom suburb of Kyoto and Osaka, the number of passengers is very large and, depending on the time zone, the congestion on trains bound for Kyoto is relatively heavy.

sen.j: また10時～16時の間、園部から来た快速電車から普通電車に乗り換えるのに、一度跨線橋(エレベータ有り）を渡る必要がある。
sen.e: From 10 am till 4 pm, passengers are required to cross the overpass (elevator is equipped) in order to transfer from Rapid trains that came from Sonobe to Local trains.
From 10 a.m. till 4 p.m., passengers are required to cross the overpass (an elevator is provided) in order to transfer to local trains from rapid trains that have come from Sonobe.
From 10 a.m. till 4 p.m., passengers are required to cross the overpass (an elevator is provided) in order to transfer to local trains from rapid trains that have come from Sonobe.

sen.j: これは当駅折り返しの普通電車が、駅舎改築工事のため1番のりばから4番のりばに変更されたためである。
sen.e: This is because the track for Local trains that make a turn at this station was changed from track 1 to track 4 due to the renovation work of the station building.
This is because the track for local trains, which make a turn at this station, was changed from track 1 to track 4 due to the process of renovating the station building.
This is because the track for local trains, which make a turn at this station, was changed from Platform 1 to Platform 4 due to the process of renovating the station building.

sen.j: そのかわり京都から来た当駅止まりの電車から園部方面に行く電車に、同じホームで乗り換えられるようになった。
sen.e: Instead, passengers of trains coming from Kyoto of which terminal is this station can transfer to trains bound for Sonobe on the same platform.
Instead, passengers of trains coming from Kyoto, for which this is the terminal station, can transfer to trains bound for Sonobe on the same platform.
Instead, passengers of trains coming from Kyoto, for which this is the terminal station, can transfer to trains bound for Sonobe on the same platform.

sen.j: 駅舎の改築に伴う2番乗り場の使用停止が解除されるまでの臨時措置と思われる。
sen.e: The above seems to be temporary measures to be effective until the suspension in use of track 2, which is associated with renovation work of the station building, is terminated.
The above seems to be a temporary measure in effect until the completion of the suspension in the use of track 2, which is associated with renovation work of the station building.
The above seems to be a temporary measure in effect until the completion of the suspension in the use of Platform 2, which is associated with renovation work of the station building.

sen.j: 嵯峨野線（京都駅-園部駅）では京都駅・二条駅に次いで多い。
sen.e: Among the stations of Sagano Line (Kyoto Station - Sonobe Station), the number of passengers of this station is the third largest after Kyoto Station and Nijo Station.
sen.cmt: 主語がわかりませんが、乗客数と推定いたしました。
sen.e: Among the stations of Sagano Line (Kyoto Station - Sonobe Station), the number of passengers of this station is the third largest after Kyoto Station and Nijo Station.
Among the stations of Sagano Line (Kyoto Station - Sonobe Station), the number of passengers of this station is the third largest after Kyoto Station and Nijo Station.

sen.j: 京都市の嵐山まで保津川を船で下る保津峡保津川下りが駅北側(徒歩10分)から乗船できる。
sen.e: Hozu-gawa River Boat Ride, which goes down the Hozu-gawa River by a boat to Arashiyama, Kyoto City, is available at the north side of the station (10 minutes walk)
The Hozu-gawa River Boat Ride, which goes down the Hozu-gawa River to Arashiyama, Kyoto City, is available at the north side of the station (a ten-minute walk).
The Hozu-gawa River Boat Ride, which goes down the Hozu-gawa River to Arashiyama, Kyoto City, is available at the north side of the station (a ten-minute walk).

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 1899年（明治32年）8月15日 - 京都鉄道の駅として開業。
sen.e: August 15, 1899 - The station commenced operation as the station of Kyoto Electric Railway.
August 15, 1899 - The station commenced operation as a facility of Kyoto Electric Railway.
August 15, 1899: The station commenced operation as a facility of Kyoto Electric Railway.

sen.j: 客貨取扱を開始。
sen.e: It commenced both passengers service and freight service.
It offered passenger service as well as freight service.
It offered passenger service as well as freight service.

sen.j: 1907年（明治40年）8月1日 - 京都鉄道国有化。
sen.e: August 1, 1907 -Kyoto Electric Railway was nationalized.
August 1, 1907 - Kyoto Electric Railway was nationalized.
August 1, 1907: Kyoto Electric Railway was nationalized.

sen.j: 1980年（昭和55年）9月30日 - 貨物取扱を廃止。
sen.e: September 30, 1980- Freight service was abolished.
September 30, 1980 - Freight service was abolished.
September 30, 1980: Freight service was abolished.

sen.j: 1987年（昭和62年）4月1日 - 国鉄分割民営化により、西日本旅客鉄道の駅となる。
sen.e: April 1, 1987 - The station became the station of West Japan Railway Company (JR West) thanks to the division and privatization of Japan National Railway (JNR).
April 1, 1987 - The station became a facility of the West Japan Railway Company (JR West) due to the division and privatization of Japan National Railway (JNR).
April 1, 1987: The station became a facility of the West Japan Railway Company (JR West) due to the division and privatization of Japan National Railway (JNR).

sen.j: 2008年（平成20年）4月12日 - 駅舎橋上化完成・使用開始。
sen.e: April 12, 2008 - The station building on the bridge was completed and placed in service.
April 12, 2008 - The station building on the bridge was completed and placed in service.
April 12, 2008: The station building on the bridge was completed and placed in service.
